topic: Conor McGregor Runs for President of Ireland
description: Former UFC champion Conor McGregor has formally launched a campaign to become the next president of Ireland, criticizing the current government on social issues like child homelessness, public safety, and immigration policy while seeking grassroots support to get on the ballot for the October 2025 election.
why_is_it_trending: Conor McGregor, a globally known mixed martial arts star, unexpectedly declared his candidacy for the Irish presidency, merging sports celebrity with a political bid.
Elon Musk publicly endorsed McGregor's campaign on social media, significantly raising its profile and sparking international attention.
McGregor's far-right, anti-immigration rhetoric and alignment with figures such as Donald Trump stimulate debate and controversy within Ireland and abroad.
key_points: McGregor announced his run on September 4, 2025, outside Dublinâ€™s government buildings, appealing to his supporters to contact local councillors to secure nominations required to appear on the presidential ballot.
He accuses the current government of failing future generations, citing rising child homelessness, increased crime, tourism decline, and strain due to immigration pressures as campaign focal points.
To run officially, McGregor needs endorsements from 20 members of the Irish parliament or 4 local councils by September 24, 2025, but many local politicians have expressed opposition.
overlook_what_might_happen_next: Whether McGregor gains enough nominations to qualify for the ballot will determine if his campaign can proceed into the official election stage.
If successful, his candidacy could shift national political dialogues on immigration, social policies, and the role of celebrity in politics.
Public and political reactions will influence voter sentiment in the October 24 presidential election and potentially affect broader political discourse in Ireland.
